ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in years at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Sex of the subject, assgined at birth

Notes: useful for determining runtime as well as whether subject idles during task

ElementDescription: Returns the stimulus tone that is displayed on the screen throughout the experiment
Reflects if the block is the experiment or practice.
Denotes if response is concurrent with a tone or self-paced without the tone, as well as if slow or fast responses required.
Reflects the trial number across the experimental blocks.

Notes: The practice block is denoted using -1.

ElementDescription: Reflects if the block is matched on the number of responses or the time responding.
